statements.sql: select `A`.*, `B`.`title`, `B`.`description` from `photos` as `A` left join `photo_languages` as `B` on `A`.`id` = `B`.`photo_id` where `B`.`language` = 'vi' and FIND_IN_SET('publish',A.status) and `A`.`type` = 'background' and `A`.`link` = 'http://localhost/laravel/begreen/san-pham/ten-san-pham-1.html' order by `A`.`priority` asc, `A`.`id` desc limit 1
hints: Use SELECT * only if you need all columns from table

hints: Use SELECT * only if you need all columns from table

hints: Use SELECT * only if you need all columns from table

statements.sql: select `A`.*, `B`.`title`, `B`.`description`, `B`.`contents`, `B`.`attributes`, `B`.`meta_seo` from `products` as `A` left join `product_languages` as `B` on `A`.`id` = `B`.`product_id` where `B`.`language` = 'vi' and `B`.`slug` = 'ten-san-pham-1' and FIND_IN_SET('publish',A.status) and `A`.`type` = 'san-pham' limit 1

LIMIT without ORDER BY causes non-deterministic results, depending on the query execution plan

hints: Use SELECT * only if you need all columns from table

statements.sql: select `A`.*, `B`.`title`, `B`.`slug` from `attributes` as `A` left join `attribute_languages` as `B` on `A`.`id` = `B`.`attribute_id` where `B`.`language` = 'vi' and `A`.`type` = 'product_tags' order by `A`.`priority` asc, `A`.`id` desc
hints: Use SELECT * only if you need all columns from table

statements.sql: select * from `comments` where `product_id` = '10' and FIND_IN_SET('publish',status) order by `parent` asc, `id` desc
hints: Use SELECT * only if you need all columns from table

statements.sql: select `A`.`id`, `A`.`code`, `A`.`regular_price`, `A`.`sale_price`, `A`.`link`, `A`.`image`, `A`.`alt`, `A`.`category_id`, `A`.`user_id`, `A`.`type`, `A`.`status`, `B`.`title`, `B`.`slug` from `products` as `A` left join `product_languages` as `B` on `A`.`id` = `B`.`product_id` where `B`.`language` = 'vi' and FIND_IN_SET('publish',A.status) and `A`.`id` != '10' and `A`.`category_id` = '1' and `A`.`type` = 'san-pham' order by `A`.`priority` asc, `A`.`id` desc limit 15
hints: The != operator is not standard. Use the <> operator to test for inequality instead.
